intro: Eriolaena barnettiae, commonly known as the pink-veined sterculia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive pink veins on its broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Eriolaena barnettiae is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in rainforest or coastal habitats. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
